meanings.definition: To beat or thrash with a flail or rod.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was swingling the wheat to separate the grains from the chaff.
meanings.sent2: She swingled the rug outside to remove the dust and dirt.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in swingling the pinata at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The waves swingled the boat back and forth in the stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith swingled the metal to shape it into a horseshoe.

meanings.definition: The act of beating or thrashing with a flail or rod.
meanings.sent1: The swingling of the wheat was a necessary step in the farming process.
meanings.sent2: The swingling of the carpet was loud and rhythmic.
meanings.sent3: The swingling of the drums echoed through the forest, scaring away the animals.
meanings.sent4: The swingling of the wind against the trees created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The swingling of the waves against the shore was calming to listen to.
